story.text: NEW YORK Shares of U.S. transportation stocks gained on Wednesday on signs of a strong economy, lower oil prices driven by milder weather, and an upgrade of several trucking firms.The Dow Jones Transportation index .DJT was up 120 points or 2.6 percent in afternoon trade to 4680.88. It was the index's best one-day percentage gain in almost four months.J.B. Hunt Transport Services (JBHT.O) rose $1.69 or 8 percent to $22.46, C.H. Robinson Worldwide (CHRW.O) was up $2.49 or 6 percent to $43.38 and Old Dominion Freight Line (ODFL.O) gained $1.67 or almost 7 percent to $25.74, after each was upgraded by Bear Stearns analyst Edward Wolfe.JB Hunt is one of the 20 components of the transports index.Gains in the sector were also driven by lower oil prices and a report by the Institute of Supply Management, which showed a rebound in U.S. manufacturing last month, said Thomas Leritz, portfolio manager with Argent Capital Management."I think people are excited about the economy," Leritz said, adding that some short-sellers in the sector were covering their positions -- buying back shares they sold -- in light of Wednesday's upbeat data.
story.title: economic data , oil , upgrades boost transport stock
